result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 22CF72 & 22CF173. 2:10 PM Defendant Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. 
22CF72-
Count 1-OWI causing injury-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 2-OWI causing injury-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 5-2nd degree reckless endangering safety-NC plea, CT does NOT accept plea at this time, 2 yr Deferred Agreement filed with the court. $150 to be paid to the DA office. 
All other counts DRI

22CF173-DRI
22FO124-DRI
22FO125-DRI

SENTENCE:
Count 1-I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to WR & GT.  probation 1 yr, 1 yr revocation with credit, AODA, AS, 90 days CT, 60 days stayed, 30 days to be served up front-concurrent w/ ea. Subj to GT & WR. Must report by 7 pm on 5/16. Must follow rules of supervision. NC w/ BMD or ALC. Maintain work/schooling/employment. No controlled substances. Subj to testing. No driving w/o valid license. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $1,316 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.

Count 2-w/h, probation 1 yr, 1 yr revocation with credit, AODA, AS, 90 days CT, 60 days stayed, 30 days to be served up front-concurrent w/ ea. Subj to GT & WR. Must report by 7 pm on 5/16. Must follow rules of supervision. NC w/ BMD or ALC. Maintain work/schooling/employment. No controlled substances. Subj to testing. No driving w/o valid license. DNA sample, $200 surcharge. $1,516 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.

60 days for state to file clarification re restitution.  PCR. 2:51 pm adj.

1:50 pm. JL-Clerk. Defendant Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern in court.  Attorney Donna Burger in court for Jeremiah Moses Morgenstern.  Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt Hahn - S&T. State req CT take JN of 22CF72. CT takes JN. CT finds identification made. cross by Atty Burger. Argument by counsel. Atty Stilin requests time for briefing and research. CT - denied. State may file motion for reconsideration. CT does not find PC. Plea NG on misd. Bond cont. 2:13 pm adj.
Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
